guide.title: GDP Status Report
guide.abstract: Status report of the GDP project

body.p: This is the status of the Gentoo Documentation Project. It will be posted regularly, but not with a static frequency. All questions can be posted to gentoo-doc@gentoo.org or to me personally.
The Gentoo Documentation Project, from now on abbreviated to GDP, has its own project page (just like almost all other Gentoo projects). You can find it at http://www.gentoo.org/proj/en/gdp.
This status mail will briefly discuss the following tasks, objectives and/or projects related to the GDP:
The Eclass HOWTO has been updated to reflect the kde eclass changes.
The Gentoo Development Policy has been updated to include a reference to the metadata document.
The Gentoo FAQ has been updated.
A Sparc Quick Installation Reference has been added.
The 2.6 koutput docs for users and developers have been put online.
The Gentoo Handbook has been updated with:

ul.li: Instructions to run genkernel --menuconfig all in case the boot partition isn't ext2 or ext3
Instructions pertaining to the Knoppix and "Other distribution" installation methods have been moved out into the Gentoo Alternative Installation Manual

body.p: A lengthy discussion on gentoo-doc has emerged regarding the Internationalisation proposal (GLEP10).
Tobias Scherbaum has also rewritten the GLEP10 proposal and posted it for discussion on gentoo-doc.
Marcelo Goncalves de Azambuja has posted his personal status update.
The Gentoo Documentation Policy has been updated. More information about the changes have been posted to gentoo-doc@gentoo.org.
